snippet: Phillip Lee of the Kimchi Taco truck opens Kimchi Grill in Prospect Heights; Mile End Sandwich, a spinoff of the Brooklyn restaurant, comes to Manhattan.
abstract: Restaurants Kimchi Grill, Mile End Sandwich, Pranzo, Pink Tea Cup Chicken and Waffles and Tavern 29, open in New York. Photo (M)
lead_paragraph: OPENING KIMCHI GRILL Phillip Lee of the Kimchi Taco truck opens a simple, contemporary-style restaurant. The chef Youngsun Lee, his original partner (no relation), is no longer involved, so it's up to Michael Calderon to cook the creative Korean fare: dishes like kimchi quesadillas, ssam buns with spicy pork or beef, and barbecued beef burritos. The truck still runs. (Opens Thursday): 766 Washington Avenue (Sterling Place), Prospect Heights, Brooklyn; (718) 360-1839.
